results.byline: By Alan Feuer, Adam Goldman and Maggie Haberman
results.title: Federal Authorities Search Home of Trump Justice Dept. Official
results.abstract: Investigators went to the suburban Washington home of Jeffrey Clark in connection with the sprawling inquiry into the Jan. 6 attack and the effort to overturn the 2020 election.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: Investigators went to the home of Jeffrey Clark, a former Justice Department official, on Wednesday.

results.title: She Fainted During the World Championships. Her Coach Came to the Rescue.
results.abstract: Anita Alvarez, an American artistic swimmer, lost consciousness while performing her solo routine in Budapest. She was “fine” afterward, her coach said.

media.caption: Anita Alvarez, an American swimmer, was rescued from the bottom of the pool during the world championships in Budapest on Wednesday.

results.byline: By Matt Richtel and Andrew Jacobs
results.title: F.D.A. Orders Juul to Stop Selling E-Cigarettes
results.abstract: The agency ruled against the company’s application to stay on the market, a decisive blow to a once-popular vaping brand that appealed to teenagers.

media.caption: In its heyday, Juul occupied 75 percent of the market share and employed 4,000 people.

results.title: I Cheated on My Wife. Why Won’t She Get Over It?
results.abstract: A reader is anguished to find that the road from confession to absolution isn’t always a direct path.

results.adx_keywords: Marijuana;Teenagers and Adolescence;Mental Health and Disorders;Addiction (Psychology);Cannabis Foods and Products;Research;Psychiatry and Psychiatrists
results.title: Psychosis, Addiction, Chronic Vomiting: As Weed Becomes More Potent, Teens Are Getting Sick
results.abstract: With THC levels close to 100 percent, today’s cannabis products are making some teenagers highly dependent and dangerously ill.

media.caption: Dabbing, a method of inhaling highly concentrated THC, has become increasingly popular among teenagers.
media.copyright: Michelle Groskopf for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Vaccination and Immunization;Rumors and Misinformation;Birx, Deborah L;Trump, Donald J;Atlas, Scott W;United States
results.title: Deborah Birx Says Trump White House Asked Her to Weaken Covid Guidance
results.abstract: The former White House coronavirus coordinator, who became a controversial figure, said there was a consistent effort to stifle information as virus cases surged in late 2020.

media.caption: Dr. Deborah L. Birx, President Donald J. Trump’s coronavirus response coordinator, told a congressional panel on Thursday that the Trump administration’s attitude toward the coronavirus had caused a “false sense of security in America.”
media.copyright: Jason Andrew for The New York Times

results.title: A Year Later, Some Republicans Second-Guess Boycotting the Jan. 6 Panel
results.abstract: The decision by Representative Kevin McCarthy not to appoint Republicans to the committee has given Democrats the chance to set out an uninterrupted narrative.

results.byline: By Jim Rutenberg and Benjamin Mullin
results.title: Rupert Murdoch and Jerry Hall Are Said to Be Divorcing
results.abstract: The media mogul’s fourth divorce is unlikely to change the ownership structure of Mr. Murdoch’s empire, but it could reverberate through companies such as Fox News and The Wall Street Journal.

media.caption: Rupert Murdoch and Jerry Hall in 2019, three years into their marriage.

results.adx_keywords: For-Profit Schools;Colleges and Universities;Student Loans;Frauds and Swindling;Foreign Students (in US);Suits and Litigation (Civil);Career Education Corporation;Grand Canyon University;University of Phoenix;DeVry University;Corinthian Colleges Inc
results.title: Government to Cancel $6 Billion in Student Loans for Defrauded Borrowers
results.abstract: Around 200,000 who sought relief after attending schools that the Education Department said showed signs of “substantial misconduct” will have their federal student loans wiped out.

media.caption: A settlement is a major step toward resolving a glut of relief claims from students who attended for-profit schools that saddled them with big bills for a subpar education.
media.copyright: Joseph Cress/Iowa City Press-Citizen, via Associated Press

results.title: Nancy Pelosi’s Napa: Wealthy Friends and a Husband’s Porsche Crash
results.abstract: An accident shines a light on the House speaker’s California life among the vineyards.

media.caption: From left, Paul and Nancy Pelosi with Gordon Getty at Mr. Getty’s 80th birthday party in San Francisco.

results.adx_keywords: Hospitals;Pregnancy and Childbirth;Women and Girls;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Deaths (Fatalities);Brigham and Women's Hospital;Boston (Mass)
results.title: Their Baby Died. Then a Boston Hospital Lost the Body.
results.abstract: Everleigh McCarthy was less than 2 weeks old when she died at Brigham and Women’s Hospital in 2020. The police said her remains were “probably mistaken as soiled linen” and discarded.

media.caption: Daniel McCarthy and Alana Ross had gone through two miscarriages when they learned she was pregnant with Everleigh in February 2020. The couple have filed a lawsuit against Brigham and Women’s Hospital.
media.copyright: Vanessa Leroy for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Primaries and Caucuses;United States Politics and Government;Conservatism (US Politics);Income Inequality;Midterm Elections (2022);Boebert, Lauren;Trump, Donald J;Aspen (Colo);Colorado
results.title: In Boebert’s District, as Elsewhere, Democrats Surge Into G.O.P. Primary
results.abstract: Thousands of Democrats in Western Colorado are voting in the primary on Tuesday against Representative Lauren Boebert, part of a broader effort to defeat far-right Republicans.

media.caption: “The center has got to re-emerge,” said Tom Morrison, center, a lifelong Democrat in rural Pitkin County who voted for the Republican candidate Don Coram, not only in protest of Representative Lauren Boebert but also of what he called a rising concern about his party’s leftward drift.
media.copyright: Daniel Brenner for The New York Times

results.title: To Catch a Snake: Largest Python Found in Everglades Signals a Threat
results.abstract: The Burmese python caught by a team of trackers breaks a record and shows the invasive species surviving in Florida’s ecosystem despite efforts to remove those snakes.

results.title: What Should You Do When Your Partner Lies About His Earnings?
results.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on a financial betrayal — and more.

results.title: Abandoned by Trump, Mo Brooks Is Now Open to Testifying About Jan. 6
results.abstract: Mr. Brooks lost his Alabama Senate runoff on Tuesday. He had been snubbed by former President Donald J. Trump, who withdrew his endorsement of Mr. Brooks and supported his rival.
